text: Michael Stephen Steele (born October 19, 1958) is an American conservative political commentator, attorney, and Republican Party politician. Steele was the seventh lieutenant governor of Maryland from 2003 to 2007. He was the first African-American elected to statewide office in Maryland. He made an unsuccessful run in the 2006 U.S. Senate election in Maryland, losing to Democrat Ben Cardin. He was the Chair of the Republican National Committee from 2009 to 2011. In 2020, he formally endorsed Joe Biden for the presidency. ==References== Category:1958 births Category:Living people Category:American political commentators Category:Lieutenant Governors of Maryland Category:Lawyers from Maryland Category:Businesspeople from Maryland Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:African- American politicians
title: Michael Steele
